tweets.text: @FarmersWeekly @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryEngland @PhilipCaseFW Problem with this story is that you’re taking Price at his word. Any examination of that mile-long stretch of the Lugg will tell you that he was not simply clearing the area around the bridge. Kingsland Parish Council and Herefordshire Council now distancing themselves from JP.🤔

"If nothing else, this case highlights the disconnect between the @EnvAgency, @NaturalEngland, @ForestryEngland, Wildlife Trusts and farmers," writes news editor @PhilipCaseFW on the #RiverLugg story which sparked much debate this week.

https://t.co/tlF7Pb9IEB

#farminguk

@GrumpyCambs @lewis_herbert @MonicaHone @Feargal_Sharkey @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs @EnvAgency @DefraUK @cllrbridget @ab4scambs @OliviaRudgard @camcitco @cllrkatie @DanielZeichner @SouthCambs @mhclg @DefraGovUK @WaterREast What did @robintprice take from @Feargal_Sharkey talk? Will “doubling nature” save Cam chalk streams? Will public be consulted about #OxCamArc regional water plans & natural capital? Sorry to keep asking but important. What have others agreed? @RSBenwell ? https://t.co/7FW3ERA133

tweets.text: At last nights Greater Cambridge Local Plan meeting Mr Kelly the Head of Planning stated he met with Water Resources East and the Companies and there were solutions to the Water abstraction issue. Details now please @SouthCambs

@greenarteries @MonicaHone @Feargal_Sharkey @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs @EnvAgency @DefraUK @cllrbridget @ab4scambs @OliviaRudgard @camcitco @cllrkatie @DanielZeichner @SouthCambs @mhclg @DefraGovUK Central principle, despite increasing national controls, is a sovereign net zero carbon Local Plan with full engagement. Rightly needs to be robust and evidence-led and able to withstand examination. 
And on water we need to work as a team and challenge @EnvAgency and companies.

tweets.text:
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Please see this information. The farmer Mr Price had an application to build 19 houses turned down this year. The link is to the planning application. The ecological report clearly informed the applicant that the whole River Lugg was a SSSI and why.
https://t.co/CDmopIGE4c https://t.co/TpPkEARaqn

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I could believe that the EA did have some prior knowledge/discussion with the local PC. Obviously poor communication all round. What's done is done now, but they now need to let a professional outfit sort whatever the problem was originally & try & recover the SSI as much as poss
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Yet the article in @guardian states EA stepped in last week to stop further work being done https://t.co/UP9V4wOD2f

Our NFM measures (felled + pinned trees) are now living up to their name as leaky woody debris dams,  holding back water in high flows and creating new in-stream habitats in Dalby Forest. Great to see new growth on the coppiced alders too. @Dalby_Forest @josh_NFM @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/rc0QUlEn0y
